original: Humbla, Per Ivan, konstnär, Gryt, f. 13/6/88 i Falkenberg av apot. A. Humbla o. Constance Engström. G. 19 m. Ester Larson. Barn: Svante f. 20, Kerstin 24, Kaj 26. — Stud. v. Gbgs h. latin 02-05, Palmgren ska sam-sik. i Sthlm 05-09, Valand 09-11, Wilhelmsons målarsk. i Sthlm 11-12, La Palette m. fl. skolor i Paris för bl. a. Le Fauconnier 13-14. Målare, teck- nare o. grafiker; målat landskap o. mariner, ofta m. djur ur den inhemska faunan såsom älgar, rävar, örnar, vildgäss m. m., även målat stilleben o. blommor. Repr. m. Självportr. i Linköp. mus., m. Uttrar i Halmstads mus. samt m. grafik i Nat :mus. o. Norrköp. mus.
translated: Humbla, Per Ivan, artist, Gryt, born June 13, 1888, in Falkenberg to pharmacist A. Humbla and Constance Engström. Married to Ester Larson in 1919 and has three children: Svante, born in 1920, Kerstin, born in 1924, and Kaj, born in 1926. Per Ivan studied at Gothenburg's Higher Latin School from 1902 to 1905, Palmgren's art school in Stockholm from 1905 to 1909, Valand from 1909 to 1911, Wilhelmson's painting school in Stockholm from 1911 to 1912, and La Palette and other schools in Paris from 1913 to 1914, where he studied with artists such as Le Fauconnier. He works as a painter, draughtsman, and graphic artist, specializing in landscapes and seascapes, often with animals from the local fauna such as elks, foxes, eagles, wild geese, etc. He has also painted still lifes and flowers. His work is represented in several museums, including his self-portrait in Linköping Museum, Otters in Halmstad Museum, and graphics in the National Museum and Norrköping Museum.

structured.name: Per Ivan Humbla
structured.description: Per Ivan Humbla was a Swedish artist known for his landscapes, seascapes, and depictions of local fauna such as elks, foxes, eagles, and wild geese. He also painted still lifes and flowers. His work is represented in several museums.
